page.title: 11THE VILLAGE OF DATCHWORTH
page.content: {Datchworth}is a village 8 km South of Stevenage & 11 km North of Hertford It has a population of 1500.The centre of the village is the crossroad at the junction of Watton Road and Bramfield Road.The village green is an important local landmark. The{11th Century {Church}is also an important feature. Datchworth is surrounded by a mixture of farmland and coniferous woodland. The housing in the village is a blend of private and local authority dwellings.There is very little employment locally except on surrounding farms. Most people commute to London or nearby towns. {Burnham Green and Tewin Wood}are small hamlets which lie along the Bramfield Road leading to Hertford. The area is mainly coniferous woodland punctured by large private dwellings.
